reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow. My husband and I stayed in the Clarendon Suite for 3 wonderful nights and had an amazing time. Michael, Viktor and Winnie did an incredible job of leaving you alone to your privacy, while supplying you with anything you might need. For example - the rooftub hotub (the icing on the cake! truly amazing) is open 24/7 and you run it yourself. No babysitting, so you really feel at home, but they are very attentive should you need anything. The decor is modern and antique mixed, lots of great books and movies to borrow, with a nice breakfast. Location is great, a quiet, private street but right near the best of the South End. Lots of thoughtful, small touches and details really make the difference. Wowie zowie!
reviews.title: Just Like Heaven

reviews.text: Absolutely superb bijou hotel in an exclusive tree-lined street in the South End. Beautiful rooms, all individually styled with every little luxury. Roof-top hot tub with views over the city. Great base for sight-seeing, a calm and luxurious haven to return to at the end of a long day's walking. You are left to yourselves, staff take a very low profile but are always contactable immediately if you need them. It feels like your own little kingdom! Breakfast is healthy and delicious, lots of fruit, eggs, breads etc. Can't praise this place too highly.
reviews.title: A private experience

We stayed in the basement (front room, no windows) all 3 nights and were upgraded to the back basement room (with windows) on the last night.

reviews.text: Good points: Nice decor, VERY comfortable bed, nice bathroom/shower, free WiFi internet, convenient location for sight-seeing/fine dining, tremendously helpful staff and a gorgeous view from the roof.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad points: The front room in the basement is very cramped and dark. I'd advise against staying there. There's a very 'laissez-faire' attitude about the breakfast. If you like being served, this might be a turn off. Parking can be a bit of a challenge if you've got a large car. We parked on a street that doesn't require a permit and were lucky to find a spot that wouldn't require us to move after a night for street cleaning.
reviews.title: A happy proposal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed here for a long weekend trip in September. Wonderful stay. Loved the room, the staff was pleasant and helpful, but gave us our space. The decor is amazing and the neighborhood is charming. We liked it so much we pretended we lived there as we roamed Tremont. Our favorite restaurants in the area were B&G Oyster Bar (lobster roll is a must, and sit at the bar), Charlie's sandwhich shop for breakfast, and the little bar at the corner of Tremont and Clarendon's street--can't remember the name).
reviews.title: nice, relaxing stay at the clarendon square inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I simply cannot sing the praises of this hotel high enough, the rooms were huge, beautifully decorated and luxurious in every way. From the massive king sized bed to the Aveda toiletries, everything in the Clarendon was sumptuous and well thought out. The staff are friendly, accomodating and more than happy to adivse you on where to go, where to eat and what to see in Boston.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — Sumptious Bed - I never wanted to get up!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast runs from early morning until about 10 (great for late risers) and consists of cereals, cold cuts, fruit, breads, bagels, croissants, yoghurts and a great selection of juices and hot drinks. And speaking of food, just out of the hotel and right is Tremont Street where you'll find some of the best restaurants in Boston, including B&G Oysters, French bistro Aquataine, and the cosy Metropolitan. The food is delicious and I was sorry not to be staying longer so I could work my way down the street and eat everywhere!

reviews.text: During my visit to Boston for the OnDemand Conference I hung my hat at the Clarendon Square Inn. I had a wonderful time there and enjoyed the B&B-life even while on a business trip. Email and TV all in a quite and beautifully restored Boston town home. Absolutely wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since my husband and I were visiting Boston during the cold season, we wanted comfortable accommodations. Clarendon Square Inn couldn't have been a better choice. Stephen and Victor were very informative and helpful with restaurant recommendations and maps. The inn is beautifully designed and maintained. Our bed was very comfortable with quality linens. We loved retiring here after a long day exploring the city. The neighborhood is also fantastic, with good restaurants. We never ate dinner more than a few blocks away. The hot tub on the room was fun to use in the winter, and easily accessible. We couldn't have been happier, and would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Amazing Place To Stay
